intro: Pimpinella menachensis, commonly known as the Menachan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are followed by small, heart-shaped fruits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
